title: runtime memory
extract: Memory footprint refers to the amount of main memory that a program uses or references while running. ... In a Java program, the memory footprint is predominantly made up of the runtime environment in the form of Java Virtual Machine (JVM) itself that is loaded indirectly when a Java application launches.
extract_html: Memory footprint refers to the amount of main memory that a program uses or references while running. ... In a Java program, the memory footprint is predominantly made up of the runtime environment in the form of Java Virtual Machine (JVM) itself that is loaded indirectly when a Java application launches.
